org.cloudgraph.hbase.graph

Class DistributedAssembler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudgraph.hbase.graph.DefaultAssembler
      • org.cloudgraph.hbase.graph.DistributedAssembler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HBaseGraphAssembler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GraphAssembler, GraphSliceAssembler, ParallelGraphAssembler, ParallelGraphSliceAssembler

    public abstract class DistributedAssembler
extends DefaultAssembler
implements HBaseGraphAssembler
    Supports the assembly of a directed data graph which may span multiple HBase tables and/or rows by maintaining a stack of row readers annotated with graph "level" and other information. This allows a specific row reader to be determined for any data object within a graph based entirely or in part on its level within the graph. This is essential for data object types which are not configured as root types within any table, and yet a specific row reader must be determined.
    Since:
    0.5.1
    Author:
    Scott Cinnamond
    See Also:
    DistributedReader, TableReader, RowReader

    • Method Detail

      • assemble

        public void assemble(Result resultRow)
        Recursively re-constitutes a data graph distributed across multiple HBase tables and/or rows, starting with the given HBase client result row.

        To retrieve the graph use DefaultAssembler.getDataGraph(). a map of selected SDO properties. Properties are mapped by selected types required in the result graph.

        Specified by:
        assemble in interface HBaseGraphAssembler
        Parameters:
        resultRow - the HBase client result (row).

      • assemble

        protected abstract void assemble(PlasmaDataObject target,
            PlasmaDataObject source,
            PlasmaProperty sourceProperty,
            RowReader rowReader,
            int level)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Populates the given data object target, recursively fetching data for and linking related data objects which make up the resulting directed graph.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs.
        Parameters:
        target - the current data object target
        source - the source or parent data object
        sourceProperty - the source (reference) property
        rowReader - the current row reader
        level - the current graph level
